metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3693 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and branch prediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a speculative buffer overflow and side-channel analysis.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

intel-microcode - 3.20180312.0~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207

notes.Note: tyhicks> Also known as "Bounds Check Bypass Store" This issue is mitigated using the same techniques as CVE-2017-5753. Ubuntu and the rest of the Linux kernel community will continue to monitor for vulnerable instances in the kernel and insert speculation barriers, as needed.

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
intel-microcode package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20180312.0~ubuntu14.04.1').
linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-157.207').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1011.11').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
